result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt Westergaard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kurt Westergaard in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke states both matters are resolved and states recs.  State notes discrepanies as the whether sentence should be forthwith or not.  State suggests Atty O'Rourke talk to ADA Albrecht and then they can commence later.  Back on the record, Atty O'Rourke talked to the DA and they are no longer objecting to a stay of the jail commencement.  State is in agreement.  Atty O'Rourke enters NC pleas to Ct 1 in 15CM567 and Cts 1 and 3 in 12CT565.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty and sentences.  

15CM567
Ct 1:  NC
10 days jail credit w/huber consecutive to sentence in 12CT565 and any other sentence
1 day credit to be applied 
$443.00 costs/surcharges to be paid today or set up payment plan w/COC's office
DNA sample to be provided
Ct 2:  Dismissed/read-in

12CT565
Ct 1:  NC
10 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence (1st 48 hrs consecutive)
To commence on or before 4/1/2016 at 6:00 pm
1 day credit to be applied
$1172.00 fine/costs/surcharges and $25.00 blood draw fee to be paid today or set up payment plan w/COC's office
Revoke DL 12 months
IID for 12 months effective upon licensure
AODA (***DE to sign up today before leaving the courthouse***)
Ct 2:  Dismissed
Ct 3:  NC
Fine/costs of $379.00 to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan

Any cash bonds to be applied
remailed to freeport address per PDOAC

Defendant Kurt Westergaard in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty O'Rourke stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty pleas - Set for Trial.  Bond continued.

Pre-trial conference at 11-20-2015 10:45 am.
Return date at 12-03-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kurt Westergaard by video from LEC with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Kurt Westergaard in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint in 15CM567.  Court addresses warrant in 12CT565.  Atty Tsai responds.  State requests cash bond of $500 in 12CT case and $500 cash in 15CT case.  Atty Tsai responds/DE does qualify for PD appt.  Advised rights to an attorney.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500.00 cash bond set in 12CT565 and $250.00 cash bond set in 15CM567.  Special bond conditions as follows in 12CT565 ONLY:  Absolute sobriety at all times and not to operate MV w/o valid DL and must submit to testing if requested by law enforcement.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
